column4: hey guys , anyone have any idee why the hell I can't access anything even if I'm root :)
p.s ( after restart everything works great )
what are you trying to access and with what app?
via terminal , files on desktop or anything
is your $HOME owned by your user?
you can double check by running:  sudo chown -R $USER:$USER $HOME
covers all bases :)
ok so when you access a folder, what happens when it goes wrong?
I get "can't access , read mode only"
is the partition healthy?
I just checked , Yes
and is your RAM healthy?
yep
when did you last run memtest?
1-2 weeks ago
and has it been acting up before taht or since then?
is the system installed on an SSD?
nop
if you make a new user, does the same occur?
didn't tried
its worth exploring
anyway it's strange that I can't access anything even as root :|
so , no idea ?
